title: [Epic] Phase 1: Rename gobject → nostr-gobject, break circular dependency
description:
Rename the gobject/ directory to nostr-gobject/, move storage_ndb.* into the library to break the circular dependency with the app, and rename all build artifacts from nostr-glib-1.0 to nostr-gobject-1.0. This is the foundational phase — everything else builds on it.

Key Deliverables:
1. Directory renamed: gobject/ → nostr-gobject/
2. storage_ndb.{c,h} moved from apps/gnostr/src/ into nostr-gobject/
3. nostr_ndb_store.c re-enabled in build
4. All build artifacts renamed (pkg-config, headers, macros: NOSTR_GLIB_* → NOSTR_GOBJECT_*)
5. Umbrella header renamed: nostr-glib.h → nostr-gobject.h
6. Version header template renamed
7. Hard-coded /opt/homebrew paths replaced with proper find_path()/pkg_check_modules()
8. Shim header left at old location
9. Meson build updated with VAPI generation
10. GIR namespace preserved as GNostr

title: Rename gobject/ directory to nostr-gobject/
description: Rename the gobject/ directory to nostr-gobject/. Update all references in root CMakeLists.txt (add_subdirectory), root meson.build, CI/CD scripts, Makefiles, and documentation references.

title: Move storage_ndb.{c,h} from app into nostr-gobject
description: Move apps/gnostr/src/storage_ndb.c and apps/gnostr/src/storage_ndb.h into nostr-gobject/src/ and nostr-gobject/include/nostr-gobject-1.0/ respectively. This breaks the circular dependency where nostr_ndb_store.c in the library includes storage_ndb.h from the app. Leave a shim header at the old location that redirects to the library header. Remove gnostr_app_inc include path from the library build.

title: Re-enable nostr_ndb_store.c in library build
description: Add nostr_ndb_store.c back into the nostr-gobject source lists in both CMakeLists.txt and meson.build. This file was previously excluded because it depended on storage_ndb.h from the app. Now that storage_ndb has been moved into the library (nostrc-lx03), this file can be compiled as part of the library. Verify it compiles cleanly with no app dependencies.

title: Rename build artifacts: nostr-glib → nostr-gobject
description:
Rename all build artifacts from nostr-glib-1.0 to nostr-gobject-1.0:
1. pkg-config: nostr-glib-1.0.pc → nostr-gobject-1.0.pc
2. Install header dir: nostr-glib-1.0/ → nostr-gobject-1.0/
3. Version header: nostr-glib-version.h.in → nostr-gobject-version.h.in
4. Macros: NOSTR_GLIB_* → NOSTR_GOBJECT_* (version macros, visibility macros)
5. Umbrella header: nostr-glib.h → nostr-gobject.h
6. Library target name: update in CMake and Meson
7. Meson project name: nostr-glib → nostr-gobject
Keep GIR namespace as GNostr (no change needed).

title: Remove hard-coded paths, use proper dependency discovery
description: Replace hard-coded /opt/homebrew/... paths in CMakeLists.txt with proper dependency discovery. Use find_path() for header discovery, pkg_check_modules() for nsync and other dependencies. Ensure build works on Linux, macOS (Homebrew + MacPorts), and other platforms.

title: Set up Meson build with GIR + VAPI generation for nostr-gobject
description:
Ensure the nostr-gobject Meson build is fully standalone with:
1. GIR generation: gnome.generate_gir() producing GNostr-1.0.gir and GNostr-1.0.typelib
2. VAPI generation: gnome.generate_vapi() producing nostr-gobject-1.0.vapi for Vala consumers
3. Meson options: Add vapi boolean option (default: true) alongside existing introspection option
4. pkg-config: Proper nostr-gobject-1.0.pc generation
5. Install rules: Headers, library, GIR, typelib, VAPI all install to correct locations
The Meson build should be fully independent — no reliance on CMake-built artifacts.

title: [Epic] Phase 2: Apps link nostr-gobject instead of inlining sources
description:
Stop apps from compiling gobject/src/*.c files directly via target_sources(). Instead, link against the nostr-gobject shared library.

Currently both gnostr and gnostr-signer apps duplicate compilation by including gobject source files directly in their builds. This defeats the purpose of having a library.

Key Deliverables:
1. Remove all target_sources(... gobject/src/*.c) lines from app CMakeLists.txt
2. Add target_link_libraries(... nostr_gobject) to both apps
3. Move D-Bus signer proxy generation to nostr-gobject as a shared target
4. Update include paths from local to library style
5. Both apps build and link successfully

title: Remove target_sources inlining of gobject sources from apps
description:
Remove all target_sources() lines that compile gobject source files directly in app builds:
- apps/gnostr/CMakeLists.txt: Remove lines adding ../../gobject/src/*.c to gnostr target
- apps/gnostr-signer/CMakeLists.txt: Remove lines adding gobject sources to signer target
These files should be compiled once in the nostr-gobject library, not duplicated per-app.

title: Link apps against nostr-gobject library
description:
Add target_link_libraries() for nostr-gobject to both apps:
- apps/gnostr/CMakeLists.txt: target_link_libraries(gnostr PRIVATE nostr_gobject)
- apps/gnostr-signer/CMakeLists.txt: target_link_libraries(gnostr_signer PRIVATE nostr_gobject)
Also update Meson builds equivalently. Verify both apps compile and link cleanly.

title: Move D-Bus signer proxy generation to nostr-gobject
description:
Move the D-Bus signer proxy generation (signer_proxy.c/h) from per-app builds into nostr-gobject as a shared build target. Currently each app that needs to communicate with the signer generates its own proxy code from the D-Bus interface XML. This should be done once in the library.

Steps:
1. Move D-Bus interface XML to nostr-gobject/dbus/
2. Add gdbus-codegen invocation to nostr-gobject CMakeLists.txt and meson.build
3. Include generated proxy in the library's public API
4. Remove per-app proxy generation from app builds
5. Update app code to use the library's proxy headers

title: Update include paths in app code to use library headers
description:
Update all #include directives in app source files from local-style to library-style:
- Before: #include "nostr_event.h"
- After: #include <nostr-gobject-1.0/nostr_event.h>
This ensures apps consume the library through its public API, not by reaching into source directories.

title: [Epic] Phase 3: Move models & services into nostr-gobject, add GNostrStore interface
description:
Move model and service classes from the app into nostr-gobject, extend the GNostrStore interface to cover the full storage API surface, and decouple services from app-specific GSettings schemas via constructor injection.

GNostrStore Interface Expansion: Extend existing GInterface (save_event, query, delete_event, count) with get_note_by_id, get_profile_by_pubkey, text_search, search_profile, subscribe/unsubscribe/poll_notes, get_note_counts/write_note_counts, count_reactions_batch/get_zap_stats_batch.

Model Moves: GnNostrEventModel (replace gtk_widget_add_tick_callback with g_timeout_add), GnTimelineQuery, thread models.

Service Moves (with constructor-injected schemas): gnostr-profile-service, gnostr-profile-provider, gnostr-sync-service, identity, relays, mute_list.

title: Extend GNostrStore interface with full API surface
description:
Extend the GNostrStore GInterface to cover the full storage API surface currently exposed by storage_ndb.h.

New vfuncs:
- Note retrieval: get_note_by_id, get_note_by_key
- Profile operations: get_profile_by_pubkey
- Search: text_search, search_profile
- Reactive store: subscribe, unsubscribe, poll_notes
- Metadata: get_note_counts, write_note_counts
- Batch operations (NIP-25/57): count_reactions_batch, get_zap_stats_batch

Update GNostrNdbStore to implement all new vfuncs. This enables alternative store backends (in-memory for tests, SQLite, etc.).

title: Move GnNostrEventModel to nostr-gobject (remove GTK dependency)
description:
Move GnNostrEventModel from apps/gnostr/src/model/ to nostr-gobject/src/.

Critical: The model uses gtk_widget_add_tick_callback() for buffer draining. Replace with GLib-only primitives (g_timeout_add with ~16ms interval, custom GSource, or g_idle_add) to keep nostr-gobject GTK-free.

Also move related model files: GnTimelineQuery, thread models, and any other model types that belong in the library.

title: Move services to nostr-gobject with constructor-injected GSettings schemas
description:
Move services from the app to nostr-gobject, replacing hardcoded org.gnostr.* GSettings schema IDs with constructor-injected parameters.

Services to move:
1. Identity service (identity.c): Add const char *schema_id constructor param
2. Relays service (relays.c): Add const char *schema_id constructor param
3. Mute list (mute_list.c): Add const char *schema_id constructor param
4. Sync service (gnostr-sync-service): Inject relay settings

Pattern: library has no opinion about schema names — apps provide their own via constructors.

title: Move profile provider and profile service to nostr-gobject
description:
Move gnostr-profile-provider and gnostr-profile-service from apps/gnostr/src/ui/ to nostr-gobject/src/.

Despite living in the ui/ directory, gnostr-profile-provider is actually a cache/service layer. It belongs alongside gnostr-profile-service in the library.

Steps: Move source/header files, update build files, ensure no GTK dependencies remain (these should be pure GObject), update app code to use library includes.

title: Decouple sync service from app relay settings
description:
The sync service currently reads relay configuration directly from app-specific GSettings or globals. Refactor to accept relay configuration via dependency injection.

Define a relay configuration interface or accept a GListModel of relay URLs. Sync service constructor takes the relay source as a parameter. App creates the relay source from its own GSettings and passes it in. Library sync service has no knowledge of app-specific settings schemas.

This allows the sync service to be reused by gnostr-signer and third-party apps with their own relay configurations.

title: [Epic] Phase 4: Bootstrap nostr-gtk library
description:
Create a new nostr-gtk library containing reusable GTK4/libadwaita widgets for displaying nostr content. Only generic widgets representing NIPs or universal nostr UI concepts go here — app-specific views stay in the app.

Widgets: GnostrTimelineView (universal event list), NoteCardRow (NIP-01 event rendering), GnostrThreadView (NIP-10 threads), GnostrComposer (NIP-01 composition), GnostrProfilePane (NIP-01 kind:0 display).

Stays in app: GnostrSessionView, DM views, settings dialogs, plugin panels.

Build system: Fully standalone Meson + CMake builds with GIR (GNostrGtk-1.0), VAPI (nostr-gtk-1.0.vapi), pkg-config (nostr-gtk-1.0.pc), Blueprint compilation. Dependencies: nostr-gobject-1.0, gtk4, libadwaita-1.

title: Create nostr-gtk directory structure and build files
description:
Bootstrap the nostr-gtk library directory with directory structure, Meson build (library target, GIR, VAPI, pkg-config, GResource, Blueprint support), CMake build, and root build integration.

Start with a minimal placeholder source file so the build works before widgets are moved.

title: Move GnostrTimelineView widget to nostr-gtk
description:
Move GnostrTimelineView from apps/gnostr/src/ui/ to nostr-gtk/src/. This is the core scrollable timeline widget displaying a list of nostr events — a universal nostr UI component.

Steps: Move source/header files, move Blueprint/UI template to resources/, update GResource XML, ensure it depends only on nostr-gobject types and GTK4/libadwaita, update app includes, add to library build files.

title: Move NoteCardRow widget to nostr-gtk
description:
Move NoteCardRow (note card widget) from apps/gnostr/src/ui/ to nostr-gtk/src/. This is the single-note display widget — a fundamental NIP-01 event rendering component.

Steps: Move source/header files, move Blueprint/UI template, update GResource XML, decouple from app-specific dependencies, update app includes, add to library build files.

title: Move GnostrThreadView widget to nostr-gtk
description:
Move GnostrThreadView from apps/gnostr/src/ui/ to nostr-gtk/src/. This widget displays NIP-10 reply threads — a generic nostr concept.

Steps: Move source/header files, move UI templates, ensure it depends on nostr-gobject thread models (moved in Phase 3), update app includes, add to library build files.

title: Move GnostrComposer widget to nostr-gtk
description:
Move GnostrComposer from apps/gnostr/src/ui/ to nostr-gtk/src/. The event composition widget is a fundamental NIP-01 component.

Steps: Move source/header files, move UI templates, decouple from app-specific services (signing should use callback/signal, not directly calling app signer), update app includes, add to library build files.

title: Move GnostrProfilePane widget to nostr-gtk
description:
Move GnostrProfilePane from apps/gnostr/src/ui/ to nostr-gtk/src/. Profile display is a NIP-01 kind:0 metadata rendering component.

Steps: Move source/header files, move UI templates, ensure it uses nostr-gobject profile service (moved in Phase 3), update app includes, add to library build files.

title: Set up GIR + VAPI generation for nostr-gtk
description:
Ensure the nostr-gtk Meson build generates GNostrGtk-1.0.gir, GNostrGtk-1.0.typelib, and nostr-gtk-1.0.vapi.

The GIR should include all public widget types with proper dependency on GNostr-1.0 (from nostr-gobject), Gtk-4.0, and Adw-1. Verify VAPI can be consumed from a simple Vala test program.

title: [Epic] Phase 5: Cleanup and polish
description:
Final cleanup after all library extractions are complete. Remove temporary shims, normalize includes, verify all generated artifacts, and update documentation.

Key Deliverables:
1. Remove shim headers at old locations
2. Normalize all #include paths project-wide
3. Remove any remaining hard-coded paths
4. Verify GIR, typelib, and VAPI generation for both libraries
5. Run full test suite
6. Update documentation (ARCHITECTURE.md, BUILD_NOTES.md)

title: Remove shim headers at old locations
description: Remove all shim/compatibility headers left at old locations during the migration (e.g. apps/gnostr/src/storage_ndb.h from Phase 1). These were temporary to keep the build working during migration.

title: Normalize include paths project-wide
description:
Audit and normalize all #include directives project-wide:
1. All references to nostr-gobject types use <nostr-gobject-1.0/...>
2. All references to nostr-gtk types use <nostr-gtk-1.0/...>
3. No remaining local-style includes for library headers
4. No remaining includes pointing to old gobject/ paths
5. No remaining includes with old nostr-glib naming

title: Verify GIR, typelib, and VAPI for both libraries
description:
Final verification that all generated introspection and binding artifacts are correct.

nostr-gobject: GNostr-1.0.gir, GNostr-1.0.typelib, nostr-gobject-1.0.vapi, nostr-gobject-1.0.pc
nostr-gtk: GNostrGtk-1.0.gir, GNostrGtk-1.0.typelib, nostr-gtk-1.0.vapi, nostr-gtk-1.0.pc

Test with g-ir-inspect, simple Vala test program, and pkg-config --cflags --libs.

title: Update documentation for new library architecture
description:
Update project documentation to reflect the new library architecture.

1. ARCHITECTURE.md: Document the dependency graph (libnostr → nostr-gobject → nostr-gtk → apps)
2. BUILD_NOTES.md: Update build instructions for both libraries
3. README.md: Update project overview to mention the libraries
4. Library READMEs: Create README.md for nostr-gobject/ and nostr-gtk/ explaining what it provides, how to build, how to consume (pkg-config, GIR, VAPI), and API overview
5. Third-party developer guide: Brief guide for consuming the libraries from other projects
